Example

Find the inverse of the matrix \[ A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -3 \\ 4 & -7 \end{bmatrix}. \]

Solution

We seek to use the above formula. So in this case note that \(a = 2, b = -3, c = 4 d = -7\). Hence \[ A^{-1} = \frac{1}{(2 \times -7) - (-3 \times 4)} \begin{bmatrix} -7 & 3 \\ -4 & 2 \end{bmatrix} = -\frac{1}{2} \begin{bmatrix} -7 & 3 \\ -4 & 2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \frac{7}{2} & -\frac{3}{2} \\ 2 & -1 \end{bmatrix} \]
